greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Integral_{x=0..1} log(floor(1/x))/(1+x) dx.
comment: The same integral with 1/x instead of floor(1/x) evaluates to Pi^2/12 = A072691.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 1.8 Khinchin-Lévy constants, p. 61.
link: David Bailey, Jonathan Borwein and Richard Crandall, On the Khintchine constant, Mathematics of Computation, Vol. 66, No. 217 (1997), pp. 417-431.
Daniel Shanks and John W. Wrench, Jr., <a href="https://www.jstor.org/stable/2309633">Khintchine's constant." The American Mathematical Monthly, Vol. 66, No. 4 (1959), pp. 276-279.
formula: Equals log(2)*log(K), where K is Khinchin's constant A002210 = 2.685452...
program: from mpmath import mp, log, khinchin
print([int(n) for n in list(str(log(2)*log(khinchin)))[2:-2]]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 08 2017
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 10 2014
